label: 無遮大会
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: a Buddhist service for the enlightenment of all sentient beings attended by persons of all strata, including monastics and nonmonastics. Such services are said to have begun in India. In Japan the first reference to a Musha-daie rite appears in the Nihon shoki in an entry for 686, during Temmu's reign. [日本書紀、天武]
